title: Hedging with physical or cash settlement under transient multiplicative price impact. (arXiv:1807.05917v2 [q-fin.PR] UPDATED)
abstract: We solve the superhedging problem for European options in an illiquid extension of the Black-Scholes model, in which transactions have transient price impact and the costs and the strategies for hedging are affected by physical or cash settlement requirements at maturity. Our analysis is based on a convenient choice of reduced effective coordinates of magnitudes at liquidation for geometric dynamic programming. translated_title: 在瞬时乘性价格影响下，通过实物或现金结算进行对冲
translated_abstract: 我们解决了Black-Scholes模型的不流动性扩展中欧洲期权的超对冲问题，其中交易具有瞬时价格影响，并且在到期时，对冲的成本和策略会受到实物或现金结算要求的影响。我们的分析基于几何动态规划的减小有效清算坐标的方便选择。价格影响随着时间的推移而短暂，是乘性的，确保基础资产价格的非负性，同时保持无套利模型。基本的（对数）线性示例是相对价格影响与交易股票数量成比例的Black-Scholes模型，其中对于名义价格的影响，对数价格的瞬时性被建模如同Obizhaeva-Wang \cite {ObizhaevaWang13}。更一般地，我们允许非线性价格影响和弹性函数。描述最小超对冲价格的粘性解由瞬时哈密顿-雅可比-贝尔曼方程所控制，我们通过基于有限元方法的数值方案解决这个问题。我们显示，对于具有短期和低行权价格的期权，现金结算通常比实物结算效率低。
tldr: 这篇论文解决了Black-Scholes模型的不流动性扩展中欧洲期权的超对冲问题，其中交易具有瞬时价格影响，并且在到期时，对冲的成本和策略会受到实物或现金结算要求的影响。使用瞬时哈密顿-雅可比-贝尔曼方程的粘性解和基于有限元方法的数值方案解决了问题，结果表明，对于具有短期和低行权价格的期权，现金结算通常比实物结算效率低。
en_tdlr: This paper addresses the superhedging problem for European options in an illiquid extension of the Black-Scholes model. The analysis considers transactions with transient price impact and the costs and strategies for hedging are affected by physical or cash settlement requirements at maturity. Using a numerical scheme based on a finite element method, the paper solves the transient Hamilton-Jacobi-Bellman equation to describe the minimal superhedging price. Results show that cash settlement is generally less cost-efficient than physical settlement for options with short maturity and low strike prices.
